dressed_first_talk: ^Do you believe there is life after death?
^Not as in an afterlife, but a person, a name, can still have life.
^That what one has made and accomplished can continue to live on and thrive long after its namesake ceases to be?
^I believe so, we live on by those who remember us and who cherished us.
^But what if one has no one who is cherished? No memories, only a name?
^Something continues on as long as a name is remembered.
^It’s not enough for a name to be remembered, a name must have meaning.
^A name must be as much an idea as it is a name.
^If one’s name does not evoke the totality of what one has achieved, what good is it?
^A name can just be a name, it can be just yours.
^A name must grow to become larger than the person it defines.
^If I have no legacy, I have no name, who am I?
^A name always means something and no person is nothing.
^If you do not survive time you are nothing.
^If you do not have a name that can be remembered then you are nothing.
^A human is nothing unless they outlive themselves. Unless they have a name to be remembered and a legacy to continue on beyond them.
^If we do not have this, then we are nothing.
^Perhaps some of us are content with being nothing.
^Perhaps being just ourselves for the time that we are is enough.
^Who am I if I am not remembered?
^If all I do not is not so my name, my legacy to live on, then I am truly nothing.
^Then all my efforts are in vain, and I am a man that has lived with nothing and will die with nothing.
^I think there is more to life than obsessing about what comes after it, part of it is for, you know, living.
^Nonsense, this life is fleeting and meaningless unless it cements you into history.
^A life is only truly lived if you are never forgotten. Great and powerful deeds define a life, not paltry comforts.
^I still think it’s what is done while you are alive and who you do it with.
dressed_second_talk: ^What do you intend to leave behind?
^After you have died, what do you leave behind from the life you lived?
^I’ll probably leave behind a bunch of stuff that my friends and family can take.
^And I’m hoping to leave behind a lot of people who love me, as sad as that would be for them.
^I haven’t really ever thought about having kids or anything so I don’t know about that…
^Those are meaningless things, do you not aim to be remembered through the ages?
^To do great deeds that shape the world?
^Uhhh… I’m sorry, but why do I have to?
^Why do I have to do that?
^You don’t have to, but why do you lack ambition?
^I don’t lack ambition, just cause I don’t want to be the one person who changes the whole world doesn’t mean I don’t have ambitions.
^I want to be kind to the people close to me, make a life for myself in whatever that means.
^Like yeah I want to help the people around me and do good and stuff.
^But working towards some abstract idea of greatness or being known forever that doesn’t really seem that important or desirable to me.
^Honestly it’s kind of selfish if you think about. Only doing things, even good things, to further your own name or legacy or whatever.
^You don’t care about anyone but yourself.
^But hundreds even thousands of lives could be changed for the better by the actions of one.
^Yeah, and that’s good, but you aren’t doing it for them are you? You aren’t doing it truly help a person out or else you wouldn’t feel the need to attach your name to it.
^You wouldn’t obsess over if your actions ensure your place in history for everyone forever. If you really cared.
^You’d just, do it. You’d just help. And sometimes maybe not even expect anything back.
^So your saying philanthropy is purely for vanity?
^And if you are in position to have that much money that giving it away to charities is like, a fun hobby for you.
^I would say it’s not just vanity but you’re probably just attempting to pay away some of the bad you’ve done to get that money.
^No rich person has ever gotten their money without ruining more than a couple lives.
^Well believe it or not, it’s true.

^Once you see almost a whole town lose their jobs overnight because one person decided that the labour of hundreds of people wasn’t fast enough despite them doing good work so they close up the factory and move it to another city.
^You make money by ruining lives, it’s just how it is.
^I would never do something like that.
^Sure, you wouldn’t, but there are people around you definitely would.
^And if you pay the salary for the man who fires my dad? Well shit, you got some hand in that, sorry to say.
^I don’t know, you can say that sucks?
dressed_third_talk: ^So if I’m not to ensure my legacy through philanthropy or business then how shall I do it? You seem to have some insights into this world that I don’t.
^You can invent something important and that would help the whole world.
^But… there’s a good chance people will just use that to exploit others or make money so that’s not an inherent good anymore.
^You could start a charity and not have your name associated with it and just give people your money.
^But like, also don’t use the charity to make more money for yourself, I know there are plenty of rich people who raise money for a “charity” but it’s just more money for themselves.
^Be nice to people. Stop trying to be so important. Volunteer your time. Give people who need money some money.
^It’s really not that hard but it also is.
^Like I’ve been worrying that I’ve not been doing enough in my life by putting my whole life on pause and dropping out of school and moving back home to help my family.

^I work and contribute to my family and I try to help the people in my town that are also having a hard time. And every damn day I feel so guilty that I’m not helping out enough, that I’m not good enough.
^Even though I’m running myself ragged trying to do things for others while I’m just… not… happy.
^And you’re here asking for the easiest solution to be a good person.
^Like I’m sorry I don’t know. I don’t know because I don’t even feel like it some days and I don’t have tons of money like it seems you do, which would literally solve all my problems.
^I apologize for my inquiry, I see now it was tactless.
dressed_fourth_talk: ^Yeah, I got a little brother and sister and my parents. And also lots of cousins and aunts and uncles and stuff that I see sometimes.
^I have a family as well, a wife and two children. A daughter and a son.
^I also understand you conflicts around… familial obligation.
^I work to ensure that my children are in the best schools. My son soon will be graduating top of his class in pre-medicine from the University of Eden.
^And my daughter is training to be a dancer with the National Dance Company and requires a number of trainers and tutors.
^I know that my children will be the best in their respective fields and so I must fund all the opportunities that ensure they achieve their fullest potential.
^It is quite “cool” I suppose. They are wonderful children and will go on to do great things.
^Are they happy? Do they like what they are doing? Being the best at whatever it is they are doing.
^They are both very driven and ambition and have chased down these opportunities equal to or exceeding the help they have received. They have quite clear minds about their futures.
^Do they like what they do? Are they happy to be a dancer or a doctor or whatever?
^Well I would assume through pursuing the things they are passionate they would be happy?
^So you don’t know? If your kids are happy? Or if they are just working hard to do something important or be the best at something?
^It’s really easy to be miserable while chasing down the thing that you think you should be, trust me, I know.
^Because at many points in my life I’ve just worked so hard to be the thing I thought I wanted to be. Or, truly, I was trying to be the thing that my parents wanted me to be.
^But that wasn’t who I was or what I wanted for myself, and it made me miserable.
^It still does.. Kind of… I’m still kind of doing it I guess. Living for them.
^Like okay, I have some nice moments with my family. I love my siblings. My parents are okay, but they don’t make it easy for me.
^I’m not really like them and they have a hard time knowing how to talk to me, or understand me, or even letting me exist…
^I fear I do not know if my children are happy or not.
^That is a catatrophic oversight on my behalf.
^Well, at least you can admit it!
^I’m sure things aren’t as hard for them cause they don’t have to work a job to feed you.
^It is alright. It offers me a frame of reference that I feel is much needed.
^I see I have been misguided on some important things for far too long.
^Hey, never too late to admit you were wrong about stuff.
^How can I repay you for services?
^Aw, it’s nothing. Helping out people without getting anything back, that’s what it’s all about right?
^As you said, and so I wish to help, without expectations.
^Well if you could find a way to get everyone in my town their jobs back, that would peachy.
^Yes, I’m certain I could have something arranged.
^No thanks needed, help without reciprocation, yes?
dressed_fifth_talk: ^Was this some sort of textile mill that was in your town?
^Excellent. I will see to it that services resume.
^I am looking to make an attempt at your advice on how to help others.
^And I can surely afford to purchase a textile mill.
^Though if you really want to help. You should let the workers own it and run it. They know the work better than anyone else and it’s been in our town for decades.
^All our problems stemmed from people owning it who never worked a day there in their lives.
^Purchase the mill and then resell it to its employees?
dressed_final_talk: ^He smiles at you warmly, and then goes back to overviewing some papers he was reading.
